title: Creating Improvised Traction Splint for Thigh Fractures
brief: How to make a traction splint from natural materials to treat broken thighbone (femur).
steps: Get two forked branches or saplings at least 5 centimeters in diameter.
Measure one from patient's armpit to 20-30 centimeters past unbroken leg.
Measure other from groin to 20-30 centimeters past unbroken leg.
Pad both splints and notch the ends without forks.
Lash a 20-30 centimeter cross member between the splints using 5-centimeter diameter branch.
Tie splint around upper body and down length of broken leg.
Fashion ankle wrap with two free ends tied to cross member.
Place 10 x 2.5 centimeter stick between cross member and foot in middle of ankle wrap.
Twist stick to create traction until broken leg equals or slightly exceeds unbroken leg length.
warnings: Check traction periodically as materials may weaken over time
Maintain manual traction if splint needs repair or adjustment
Watch for signs of circulation problems below the fracture
